caption:
This photograph captures a natural, outdoor setting focused on various plants. The main focal points are clusters of elongated pods which appear predominantly in the foreground, hanging vertically. These pods are light green with hints of purple and have a frosted or dew-speckled surface, giving them a textured appearance. They hang from what appear to be thin, bending stems intertwined with other vegetation.

To the right side of the image, there is a pair of blooming thistle flowers, exhibiting rich pink to purple colors. These flowers stand out due to their vibrant color against the predominantly green backdrop. Each flower has a set of spiny green leaves encircling its base which adds to the texture and complexity of the scene.

The background of the photograph is slightly blurred but consists of dense greenery, indicating a lush environment. This blurring effect focuses attention on the pods and the thistle flowers, while still suggesting a rich, verdant setting typical of a wild or uncultivated area.

The overall composition and the quality of light suggest this photograph might have been taken during daylight with natural sunlight illuminating parts of the plants and creating shadows and highlights that enhance the textures and colors of the plants. The image invokes a sense of tranquility and natural beauty, emphasizing the intricate details of wild flora.
title: Marshlands in the cuyahoga valley produce abundant milkweed (asclepias syriaca) and bull thistle (cirsium vulgare) these plants are located near jaite, north of Peninsula, Ohio, which is south of Cleveland.  This area is part of the newly created cuyahoga valley national recreation area which contains 30,000 acres in a 20-mile stretch of largely undeveloped land located between the metropolitan districts of Cleveland and Akron.  Land purchases await Congressional appropriations
